IssueBody:
Keeping these packages up to date is made possible via automation. However, the descriptions are often cut out of the original projects readme files. For this I'm looking for PR's that correct descriptions that have changed for these projects. 

You can look through the projects listed and compare the ReadMe to the description field in the corresponding nuspec file. I'll also accept updates to tags as long as the description has also changed.

IssueName: Dark mode toggle button with dark mode implementation
IssueBody:
A switch button to enable and disable dark mode. Also, the dark mode should be able to work on all the pages, and it should save its theme in local storage. If there is no theme set, use light mode by default.
Whenever the website is opened next time, the previous theme should be used.

I'd love to get some documentation started for the 3.x branch. Any PR's should be in the form of edits to the ReadMe on the 3.x branch or additional markdown files placed near the code they explain. Keep the formatting simple but use headers. If you have questions, just ask them here and I'll get back to you ASAP.

Mostly needed will be updates to the ReadMe regarding the new CLI and NuGetDefense.json settings. Pretty open ended an I'll accept any PR that passes a basic quality check (accuracy and readability). 

All documentation on a single subject should be in the same PR. Multiple PR's to the same file from the same user may be considered SPAM.

IssueBody:
<!--
Thank you for adding a feature request to Boa! As this is an experimental JavaScript engine, there will probably be many ECMAScript features left to implement. In order to understand the feature request as best as possible, please fill the following template. Feel free to add or remove sections as needed.
-->

**ECMASCript feature**
https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-array.prototype.at

**Example code**
This is the same feature added for String.prototype.at() - https://github.com/boa-dev/boa/pull/1375

This code should now work and give the expected result:
```javascript
const arr1 = [1,5,6,2];
arr1.at(-1) // 2
```
The expected output is `2`.
Labels: enhancement, good first issue, Hacktoberfest, E-Easy

IssueName: Migrate all stylus styles to sass
IssueBody:
We currently have at least 2 style engines utilized: sass and stylus. There is no need in stylus as we have sass already. We need to migrate all styles to sass to be able to customize theme colors in the future
Some examples:
https://github.com/bitcartcc/bitcart-store/blob/ca1ba4e8d782999c9c02e46fbddf9ec806dd6bfb/components/Switch.vue#L24-L26
https://github.com/bitcartcc/bitcart-store/blob/8909d56c7c2cf431ae93e8b97958a418cd3aa366/pages/index.vue#L53-L68
https://github.com/bitcartcc/bitcart-store/blob/8909d56c7c2cf431ae93e8b97958a418cd3aa366/components/Sidebar.vue#L64-L101

Also any improvements to the existing files are welcome!

The project has a working Raspberry Pi image will work via USB or SD card and pull up the arm64 options using the pipxe project.  Evaluate which options work and don't and raise upstream issues depending on behaviors.

May need to pull in the latest dependencies into pipxe to make sure we have all the latest fixes.

IssueName: Can we show date along the X axis on the conformance tests?
IssueBody:
Looking at the graph on https://boa-dev.github.io/boa/test262/# its not easy to know what time the test represent. It would be nice to show the years along the bottom or something to know how far back these results are showing.

Example below:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/936006/135323878-35a9b62f-d15b-4b9d-b3c7-fb2fb7e2959b.png)

Looking at the [data](https://github.com/boa-dev/boa/blob/gh-pages/test262/refs/heads/master/results.json) it seems only the commit is stored, so for backdating we may need to run a script which returns the datetime for each commit. Each item in that JSON should also have an ISO date field for past and future additions

## Background

This issue provides directions on how you can contribute to our projects by updating our documentation. Please keep this issue open.

You can make both technical and non-technical updates to documentation. 

## Tasks

- [ ] Check out the open documentation issues
- [ ] Read & follow the instructions in the Getting Started section of the readme.md to set the solution up (find projects[ here](https://call-for-code-for-racial-justice.github.io/Hacktoberfest/#/projects/legit-info)) 

If any directions are unclear, outdated, and are not addressed in [open documentation issues](https://github.com/search?q=user%3Acall-for-code-for-racial-justice+label%3Ahacktoberfest+label%3Adocumentation&type=Issues): 
- [ ] create a new issue using the documentation template
- [ ] label it 'hacktoberfest', 'documentation' assign the issue to yourself,
- [ ] Discuss your changes in the issue 

Once your documentation idea is approved
- [ ] update the readme.md file with your changes
- [ ] submit a pull request to main branch
- [ ] PR merged by team
- [ ] Congratulations! 

If you are unfamilar with pull requests, committing code on Github, we recommend you check out our free course on open source: [ibm.biz/opensourcecourse](ibm.biz/opensourcecourse)

Fill-in the [Layer5 Community Member Form](https://layer5.io/newcomer) and join the [Layer5 Community Slack](http://slack.layer5.io) for access.

<!--
Please submit only documentation-related issues with this form, or follow the
Contribute to OpenShift guidelines (https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/blob/main/contributing_to_docs/contributing.adoc) to submit a PR.
-->

### Which section(s) is the issue in?

Specifying how a service is monitored: https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/monitoring/managing-metrics.html#specifying-how-a-service-is-monitored_managing-metrics

### What needs fixing?

The procedure numbering is off. After step 2, the numbering restarts at 1:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7443887/135319460-7aafe2d8-f498-456f-a465-49e8bbb6270f.png)

I believe that the NOTE after step 2 is the culprit. It likely just needs a "+" continuation character on the line before the note, so that the note is indented properly with step 2.

IssueName: Missing source in code blocks in limit ranges
IssueBody:
<!--
Please submit only documentation-related issues with this form, or follow the
Contribute to OpenShift guidelines (https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/blob/main/contributing_to_docs/contributing.adoc) to submit a PR.
-->

### Which section(s) is the issue in?

Restrict resource consumption with limit ranges: https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/nodes/clusters/nodes-cluster-limit-ranges.html

### What needs fixing?

A few modules in this limit ranges assembly have code blocks that are missing the source specification. They need to have `[source,terminal]` added above the code block, like:

```
[source,terminal]
----
// command
----
```

- https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/nodes/clusters/nodes-cluster-limit-ranges.html#nodes-cluster-limit-creating_nodes-cluster-limit-ranges, step 2 needs [source,terminal]
- https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/nodes/clusters/nodes-cluster-limit-ranges.html#nodes-cluster-limit-viewing_nodes-cluster-limit-ranges, all 4 code blocks need [source,terminal]
- https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/nodes/clusters/nodes-cluster-limit-ranges.html#nodes-cluster-limit-ranges-deleting_nodes-cluster-limit-ranges, code block needs [source,terminal]

* An Establishment can register itself on the Web Application.
* An Establishment can register an EstablishmentContact (One or Many).
* An Establishment can register an Event (One or Many).
* An Establishment can edit its own details.
* An Establishment cannot view details of any other Establishment.
* An Establishment cannot list Providers.
* An Establishment can delete itself from the Web Application.

IssueName: YAML source missing for code blocks
IssueBody:
<!--
Please submit only documentation-related issues with this form, or follow the
Contribute to OpenShift guidelines (https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/blob/main/contributing_to_docs/contributing.adoc) to submit a PR.
-->

### Which section(s) is the issue in?

Installing the Cluster Resource Override Operator using the web console: https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/nodes/clusters/nodes-cluster-overcommit.html#nodes-cluster-resource-override-deploy-console_nodes-cluster-overcommit

### What needs fixing?

Steps 3 and 4 have code blocks with YAML in them, but the source isn't specified as YAML, so it's not being highlighted. Above the code block for each of these, we need to add `[source,yaml]` so that the YAML is colored/highlighted properly.

Once that is added, the code block should be colored, like this example is:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7443887/135316542-d403a517-b37f-4bba-84e0-e753cc8fa3e7.png)

* A User can register itself to the Web Application.
* A User can edit its own details
* A User cannot retrieve details of any other User
* A User can delete itself from the Web Application.

* A User cannot list the Providers registered in the Web Application.

<!--
Please submit only documentation-related issues with this form, or follow the
Contribute to OpenShift guidelines (https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/blob/main/contributing_to_docs/contributing.adoc) to submit a PR.
-->

### Which section(s) is the issue in?

Creating the frontend service: https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/openshift_images/templates-using-ruby-on-rails.html#templates-rails-creating-frontend-service_templates-ruby-on-rails

### What needs fixing?

Something is off about this procedure, where step 3 is an "Example output", and then after that code block, the numbering resets to 1:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7443887/135313883-cd2aeedb-8765-4f6d-ac30-7ab0a9059f88.png)

I'm guessing that the example output heading there is currently `. Example output` (which marks it as a list), but instead there should be no space after the period, like `.Example output`, which would render it as a heading.

1. Add your profile picture to the folder
Add a picture picture of your choice in static/images/. Accepted files are png and jpg, should be squared and minimum size 544x544 pixels. Ex.

static/images/<YOUR-USERNAME>.png
2. Add your profile information
Create a markdown file in your folder following the convention content/participant/<YOUR-USERNAME>.md. Ex.

content/participant/<YOUR-USERNAME>.md/
Copy the next template into your file, delete the boilerplate data and fill the information with yours.


name: YOURNAME
institution/company: INSTITUTION_NAME
github:USERNAME

IssueName: Callouts should use normal callout syntax
IssueBody:
<!--
Please submit only documentation-related issues with this form, or follow the
Contribute to OpenShift guidelines (https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/blob/main/contributing_to_docs/contributing.adoc) to submit a PR.
-->

### Which section(s) is the issue in?

Running tasks in pods using jobs: https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/nodes/jobs/nodes-nodes-jobs.html#nodes-nodes-jobs-creating-cron_nodes-nodes-jobs

### What needs fixing?

The callouts below the code block use regular numbers to specify the text for each callout:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7443887/135311926-b12bf1e7-050f-44df-b8f6-b89f7026b437.png)

Instead, they should use the callout syntax, which looks like:

```
<1> The pod replicas a job should run in parallel.
<2> Successful pod completions are needed to mark a job completed.
...
```

This will render the numbers in a blue circle, like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7443887/135312377-a9de711b-a459-4074-a508-e0f783bf1d2b.png)

IssueName: [refactoring] migrate from convention to syntax for private fields
IssueBody:
**Problem**
We're handling private fields using the `_field` convention. As this is a convention, the fields are still accessible.

**Proposed solution**
Now we can use `#field` syntax: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Working_With_Private_Class_Features, that is supported since Node 6, so there are no issues with introducing the syntax to this project.

The proposal is to change it across the whole codebase. We can make chunks of changes in different PRs if that's helpful.

IssueName: Menu: First item should receive focus when opened
IssueBody: The first menu item does not receive focus when opened (user must tab to the first menu item).

This issue is intended to practice software architecture skills as well as unit testing.

As you may have noted, there's a one-to-one correspondence between the `Chess\Game` methods described in the [PHP Chess Docs](https://php-chess.readthedocs.io/en/latest/game-methods/) and the commands available in the chess server:

- `ascii(): string` <-> `ChessServer\Command\AsciiCommand.php`
- `captures(): array` <-> `ChessServer\Command\CapturesCommand.php`
- `castling(): ?array` <-> `ChessServer\Command\CastlingCommand.php`
- ...

All commands should be unit tested in [`ChessServer\Tests\Unit\Command`](https://github.com/chesslablab/chess-server/tree/master/tests/unit/Command). However, the `ChessServer\Tests\Unit\Command\CastlingTest.php` file is missing.

The missing file should be added as per the existing conventions.

Happy learning and coding!

**Problem**
We're handling private fields using the `_field` convention. As this is a convention, the fields are still accessible.

**Proposed solution**
Now we can use `#field` syntax: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Working_With_Private_Class_Features, that is supported since Node 6, so there are no issues with introducing the syntax to this project.

The proposal is to change it across the whole codebase. We can make chunks of changes in different PRs if that's helpful.

IssueName: Menu: Esc key should close the menu
IssueBody: The `Esc` key does not work as advertised (VoiceOver, for example, understands that Menu is a menu and reads “press the Esc key to close”, but we do not offer this functionality). This means that to close the menu, the user must ensure they have tabbed to the button and then hit return/space to close.

IssueName: Create an example page - as a guideline document
IssueBody:
- [ ] create markdown page titled example-page.md
- [ ] add in an example Django code snippet into the page
- [ ] include consistent formatting and styling (refer to the readme.md if this section has been updated)

### ⭐ Request Type

Add brief documentation on the StringBuilder Class in Java.
The markdown file is located [here](https://github.com/Utkarsh1504/DSA-Java/blob/main/lessons/string-builder.md).

### Lesson Content
1. Introduction
2. Code examples for StringBuilder
3. code explanation

### 💻 Location

This lesson is present under the
Section: 6
Lesson: B
Location Order: 6B

IssueName: Command and text are cut off in a note
IssueBody:
<!--
Please submit only documentation-related issues with this form, or follow the
Contribute to OpenShift guidelines (https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/blob/main/contributing_to_docs/contributing.adoc) to submit a PR.
-->

### Which section(s) is the issue in?

"Creating cron jobs": https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/nodes/jobs/nodes-nodes-jobs.html#nodes-nodes-jobs-creating-cron_nodes-nodes-jobs


### What needs fixing?

The note at the bottom of the page has a long command that is wider than the box and some of the words and command are cut off:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7443887/135310604-63d9aea1-f809-4f70-b4cc-3e79848fc98c.png)

This can probably be fixed by using "\\" to continue the command onto a second line, like:

```
$ oc create cronjob pi --image=perl --schedule='*/1 * * * *' \ 
-- perl -Mbignum=bpi -wle 'print bpi(2000)'
```

### ⭐ Request Type

Add in-depth documentation on the Strings in Java.
The markdown file is located [here](https://github.com/Utkarsh1504/DSA-Java/blob/main/lessons/intro-string.md).

### Lesson Content
The lesson must contain at least these are the topics:

1. Introduction
2. What is String?
3. String Creation: String Literal
4. String Creation: new Keyword
4. How Strings Stored In Memory
5. String Pooling
6. String Immutability In Java
7. String Comparison
8. PrintStream Class
9. Important Strings Methods
10. String Operations
10. Format Specifier
11. String VS String Buffer
12. Some code examples
13. Conclusion


### 💻 Location

This lesson is present under the
Section: `6`
Lesson: `A`
Location Order: `6A`
File-Name: [`intro-string.md`](https://github.com/Utkarsh1504/DSA-Java/blob/main/lessons/intro-string.md)

You can take the help of other markdown files in the [/lesson](https://github.com/Utkarsh1504/DSA-Java/blob/main/lessons/loops.md) directory so that you get the idea of in which fashion you should write.

If you don't know how to do markdown, don't worry it is quite easy, just follow this docs-https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/

If your concepts are not that good follow this String and StringBuilder In Java video of @kunal-kushwaha (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zL1DPZ0Ovlo)
Labels: documentation, enhancement, help wanted, java, hacktoberfest

IssueBody: Create a solid rectangle with stars

The Database will include the following Entities:

* Role: To identify if user is Provider, Client or Establishment.
* Contact (Abstract entity for ProviderContact and EstablishmentContact): Name, Phone Number, Role ID
* Provider: Name, Address.
* ProviderContact: Position (Management, Administration, Operative), Provider ID.
* Product: Name, Description, SKU, Barcode (EAN-13), Cost, Sale Price, Taxable, Provider ID.
* Establishment: Name, Address.
* EstablishmentContact: Establishment ID.
* Event: Name, Date, Details, Establishment ID.
* Client: Name, Email, Address, Password, Role.
* Reservation: A Client can make a reservation with many Establishment. An establishment can have a reservation of many Client. Table Number, Party of (Number of participants).

IssueName: Banner: Close button should have a more distinct `aria-label`
IssueBody: Close button on the `Banner` should be more distinct `aria-label` (ex. "Close notification") so its clear what it relates to rather than just "close"

To some degree, Dayong allows high-level customization through the [config.json](https://github.com/SurPathHub/Dayong/blob/main/config.json) file. Although we only use it now to change how we experience commands and interactions, it's likely to cause erroneous behaviors, especially as the config file becomes larger as we add more features that rely on it.

Configuration checking helps us avoid any problems that may arise from using the config.json file by first verifying that software requirements are met. It's basically just a process that tells us whether a configuration is good or bad. Dayong does not have that kind of functionality yet.
Labels: enhancement, good first issue, help wanted, hacktoberfest

IssueBody:
This issue is intended to practice software architecture skills as well as unit testing.

As you may have noted, there's a one-to-one correspondence between the `Chess\Game` methods described in the [PHP Chess Docs](https://php-chess.readthedocs.io/en/latest/game-methods/) and the commands available in the chess server:

- `ascii(): string` <-> `ChessServer\Command\AsciiCommand.php`
- `captures(): array` <-> `ChessServer\Command\CapturesCommand.php`
- `castling(): ?array` <-> `ChessServer\Command\CastlingCommand.php`
- ...

All commands should be unit tested in the [`ChessServer\Tests\Unit\Command`](https://github.com/chesslablab/chess-server/tree/master/tests/unit/Command) namespace; however, the `ChessServer\Tests\Unit\Command\AsciiTest.php` file is missing at the present moment.

The missing file should be added as per the existing conventions.

Happy learning and coding!

Many quantum applications use the [Hamming Distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamming_distance) between two states.

While this is a fairly straightforward thing to calculate, we should make it even easier and keep users from having to think about it at all.

We should also allow the function to accept all state representation forms:

A) integers representing states in their binary forms. for example `4 = "100"`
B) string form of a binary number, like `"100"`
C) array of booleans, like `[1,0, 0]`

Potential examples:
```
>>> qml.HammingDistance(3,4) 
3
>>> qml.HammingDistance("100", "011")
3
>>> qml.HammingDistance([1,0,0], [0,1,1])
3
```

This utility function could be placed in the [`utils.py`](https://github.com/PennyLaneAI/pennylane/blob/master/pennylane/utils.py) file.
